intro: Hieracium isopleurum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically includes plants with showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters, typical of the genus Hieracium. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed sites.
